column4: this is what the synaptic package manager sais: This package contains the source needed to generate the kernel module. You can
compile it manually or using kernel-package.
How do i use the kernel-package?
install kernel-package, and then see the docs in /usr/share/doc/kernel-package.  It will involve using make-kpkg with fakeroot.
i am a windows user that has no idea about command line stuff : /
do you really need a custom kernel?
some kind of file system enhancement
which?
http://ftpfs.sourceforge.net/
what for?
can't gnome-vfs do that?
i have tried, but i have no idea on how to do that..
further, that projects says it's obsoleted by LUFS
first, I'd suggest sftp over ftp, anyway.
i managed to connect to ftp and so on, but i cannot change files like i want to. And it is the LUFS i am talking about
can you help me with gnome-vfs?
can you use sftp?

I'd try: Places->Connect to Server
then what's the problem?
I took a look at it myself.  I can't save over gnome-vfs either.  Can you live with drag-n-drop?  Save changes locally, and copy them over with nautilus.
okay, I need to get going.
sure.  See my last message.  That's the best you can do, I think.
